titles.title: Intellectual Property Antitrust Protection Act of 1997
To modify the application of the antitrust laws to encourage the licensing and other use of certain intellectual property.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 1/9/1997--Introduced. Intellectual Property Antitrust Protection Act of 1997 - Provides that in any action in which the conduct of an owner, licensor, licensee, or other holder of an intellectual property right is alleged to be in violation of the antitrust laws in connection with the marketing or distribution of a protected product or service, such right shall not be presumed to define a market, to establish market power, or to establish monopoly power.
